key.name: terminal-id
key.description: The application path used as a reference when initializing a new terminal

key.name: terminal-shortcut
key.description: Shortcut to activate the terminal application

key.name: vertical-size
key.description: Specify the vertical size of the terminal in percentage

key.name: horizontal-size
key.description: Specify the horizontal size of the terminal in percentage

key.name: horizontal-alignment
key.description: Control the value for horizontal alignment

key.name: render-on-current-monitor
key.description: When enabled, the Terminal will be shown on the Display that currently has the mouse pointer

key.name: render-on-primary-monitor
key.description: When enabled, the Terminal will be shown on the Display set as Primary in Gnome Display settings

key.name: monitor-screen
key.description: Specify the display where the terminal should be rendered

key.name: auto-hide-window
key.description: When enabled, this hides the Terminal window when it loses focus

key.name: always-on-top
key.description: When enabled, terminal window will appear on top of all other non-topmost windows

key.name: animation-time
key.description: Duration of the dropdown animation in milliseconds

key.name: skip-taskbar
key.summary: Hide terminal window in certain modes
key.description: When enabled, the terminal window will not appear in overview mode or when using Alt+Tab.

key.name: launch-args-map
key.description: Dictionary mapping application IDs to their terminal launch arguments
